Ingest_LDD.name: MGN
Ingest_LDD.comment:
The MGN dictionary contains classes that describe aspects of the Magellan mission and related instruments.
MGN version 1.2.0.0 PDS Build 1.24.0.0 (1O00) LDDTool version 15.3.0
Created with lddtool -plJ -V 1O00 PDS4_MGN_IngestLDD.xml

DD_Attribute.name: band_name
DD_Attribute.definition: The name of the radio band in which the signal was received.

DD_Permissible_Value.value_meaning: S band
X band

DD_Attribute.name: clock_intercept_coeff
DD_Attribute.definition: Intercept coefficient of the SCLK/SCET conversion (A0), 19-character ASCII string

DD_Attribute.name: clock_slope_coeff
DD_Attribute.definition: Slope coefficient of the SCLK/SCET conversion (A1), 12-character ASCII string

DD_Attribute.name: clock_utc_to_j2000_correction_factor
DD_Attribute.definition: UTC-to-epoch J2000 correction factor (DUT), 6-character ASCII string

DD_Attribute.name: dsn_station_number
DD_Attribute.definition: The number of the DSN antenna used to collect the data.

DD_Attribute.name: mapping_cycle
DD_Attribute.definition: The mapping cycle in which the data were acquired. Should be 1 to 6.

DD_Attribute.name: mapping_start_time_tdb
DD_Attribute.definition: Mapping start time (SCET) in TDB seconds from epoch J2000

DD_Attribute.name: mapping_start_time_utc
DD_Attribute.definition: Mapping start time (SCET) in UTC timestamp

DD_Attribute.name: mapping_stop_time_tdb
DD_Attribute.definition: Mapping stop time (SCET) in TDB seconds from epoch J2000

DD_Attribute.name: mapping_stop_time_utc
DD_Attribute.definition: Mapping stop time (SCET) in UTC timestamp

DD_Attribute.name: mission_phase_name
DD_Attribute.definition: The mission_phase_name attribute provides the mission-defined name of a time period within the mission.

DD_Permissible_Value.value_meaning: The first mapping cycle extended from completion of the orbit trim and checkout phase until completion of one cycle of radar mapping (approximately 243 days). Started 1990-09-15 and ended 1991-05-15.

The second mapping cycle extended from completion of the first mapping cycle through an additional cycle of mapping. Acquisition of 'right-looking' SAR data was emphasized. Radio occultation measurements were carried out on orbits 3212-3214. A period of battery reconditioning followed completion of Cycle 2. Started 1991-05-16 and ended 1992-01-17.

The third mapping cycle extended from completion of battery reconditioning through an additional cycle of mapping (approximately 243 days). Acquisition of 'stereo' SAR data was emphasized. The last orbit in the third cycle was orbit 5747. Started 1992-01-24 and ended 1992-09-14.

The fourth mapping cycle extended from completion of the third mapping cycle through an additional cycle of mapping. Acquisition of radio tracking data for gravity studies was emphasized. Radio occultation measurements were carried out on orbits 6369, 6370, 6471, and 6472. Because of poor observing geometry for gravity data collection at the beginning of the cycle, this cycle was extended 10 days beyond the nominal 243 days. Orbits included within the fourth cycle were 5748 through 7626. Periapsis was lowered on orbit 5752 to improve sensitivity to gravity features in Cycle 4. Started 1992-09-14 and ended 1993-05-25.

The aerobraking phase extended from completion of the fourth mapping cycle through achievement of a near-circular orbit. Circularization was achieved more quickly than expected; the first gravity data collection in the circular orbit was not scheduled until 11 days later. Orbits included within the aerobraking phase were 7627 through 8392. Started 1993-05-26 and ended on 1993-08-05.

The fifth mapping cycle extended from completion of the aerobraking phase through an additional cycle of mapping (approximately 243 days). Acquisition of radio tracking data for gravity studies was emphasized. The first orbit in the fifth cycle was orbit 8393. Started on 1993-08-16 and ended on 1994-04-15.

The sixth mapping cycle extended from completion of the fifth mapping cycle through an additional cycle of mapping (approximately 243 days). Acquisition of radio tracking data for gravity studies was emphasized. The first orbit in the sixth cycle was orbit 12249. Started on 1994-04-16.
The prime science phase of the mission. This value occurs in the original PDS labels of the MIDR products.

DD_Attribute.name: nav_uid_ephemeris_file
DD_Attribute.definition: NAV Unique ID of the Spacecraft Ephemeris File. Will be blank if ephemeris file wasn't used.

DD_Attribute.name: oblique_sinusoidal_start_time_tdb
DD_Attribute.definition: Oblique sinusoidal start time (SCET) in TDB seconds from epoch J2000

DD_Attribute.name: oblique_sinusoidal_start_time_utc
DD_Attribute.definition: Oblique sinusoidal start time (SCET) in UTC timestamp

DD_Attribute.name: oblique_sinusoidal_stop_time_tdb
DD_Attribute.definition: Oblique sinusoidal stop time (SCET) in TDB seconds from epoch J2000

DD_Attribute.name: oblique_sinusoidal_stop_time_utc
DD_Attribute.definition: Oblique sinusoidal stop time (SCET) in UTC timestamp

DD_Attribute.name: orbit_argument_of_periapsis
DD_Attribute.definition: Argument of periapsis in degrees from the Orbit Header file on the EDR, J2000 coordinates

DD_Attribute.name: orbit_ascending_node_lon
DD_Attribute.definition: Longitude of the ascending node in degrees (0 to 360) from the Orbit Header file on the EDR, J2000 coordinates

DD_Attribute.name: orbit_eccentricity
DD_Attribute.definition: Orbit eccentricity from the Orbit Header file on the EDR

DD_Attribute.name: orbit_inclination
DD_Attribute.definition: Orbit inclination angle in degrees from the Orbit Header file on the EDR

DD_Attribute.name: orbit_number
DD_Attribute.definition: The orbit_number attribute identifies the number of the orbital revolution around a target body.

DD_Attribute.name: orbit_period
DD_Attribute.definition: Orbit period

DD_Attribute.name: orbit_semimajor
DD_Attribute.definition: Orbit semi-major axis from the Orbit Header file on the EDR

DD_Attribute.name: organization_id
DD_Attribute.definition: The organization that produced the data.

DD_Permissible_Value.value_meaning: Stanford University Element of the Venus Express Radio Science Team

DD_Attribute.name: original_pds_volume_id
DD_Attribute.definition: The original PDS volume_id of where the Magellan data are located.

DD_Attribute.name: pixel_size
DD_Attribute.definition: Length of a side of each pixel in this observation

DD_Attribute.name: predicted_periapsis_sclk
DD_Attribute.definition: Predicted time of periapsis in SCLK, 15-character ASCII string (see SIS Appendix A)

DD_Attribute.name: predicted_periapsis_tdb
DD_Attribute.definition: Predicted time of periapsis in TDB seconds from epoch J2000

DD_Attribute.name: producer_institution_name
DD_Attribute.definition: The producer_institution_name attribute identifies a university, research center, NASA center, or other institution associated with the production of a data product.

DD_Attribute.name: product_type
DD_Attribute.definition: The product_type attribute indicates the type of data for an individual data product. The values are based on the values used by the Magellan project for their delivery to PDS.

DD_Permissible_Value.value_meaning: Full resolution Mosaicked Image Data Record
Compressed one time Mosaicked Image Data Record
Compressed two times Mosaicked Image Data Record
Compressed three times Mosaicked Image Data Record
Polar projected Mosaicked Image Data Record
Full resolution Basic Image Data Record
Compressed Basic Image Data Record
Altimetry and Radiometry Composite Data Record
Global topography map data record
Global emissivity map data record
Global reflectivity map data record
Global slope map data record
Global map image Data Record with maps for topography, emissivity, slope and reflectivity
Surface Characteristics Vector Data Record
Global Vector Data Record
Bistatic Radar
Line Of Sight Acceleration Profile Data Record
Spherical Harmonic Data Record for topography and gravity models

DD_Attribute.name: product_version_id
DD_Attribute.definition: The product_version_id attribute identifies the version of an individual data product.

DD_Attribute.name: projection_name
DD_Attribute.definition: The map projection used in this product, either 'sinusoidal' or 'oblique sinusoidal'

DD_Permissible_Value.value_meaning: Non-oblique sinusoidal map projection
Oblique sinusoidal map projection

DD_Attribute.name: projection_origin_lat
DD_Attribute.definition: Latitude of the map projection's origin, in degrees

DD_Attribute.name: projection_origin_lon
DD_Attribute.definition: Longitude of the map projection's origin, in degrees (0 to 360)

DD_Attribute.name: radar_look_direction
DD_Attribute.definition: The radar_look_direction attribute provides the direction the radar antenna was pointing relative to the spacecraft ground track along a given orbit. Most cases were Left or Right. Stereo indicates left looking with an incidence angle for stereo measurements. Maxwell is a special case for observing the Maxwell feature.

DD_Permissible_Value.value_meaning: Left looking observation
Right looking observation
Mixed looking observation (both left and right)
Stereo observation
Maxwell observation

DD_Attribute.name: received_polarization_type
DD_Attribute.definition: The radio polarization of the receiving antenna and feed.

DD_Permissible_Value.value_meaning: Right circular polarization
Left circular polarization

DD_Attribute.name: reference_sclk_factor
DD_Attribute.definition: Reference SCLK factor (SCLK0), 13-character ASCII string

DD_Attribute.name: spacecraft_clock_count_partition
DD_Attribute.definition: The spacecraft_clock_count_partition attribute indicates the clock partition active for the spacecraft_clock_start_count and spacecraft_clock_stop_count attributes.

DD_Attribute.name: spacecraft_clock_start_count
DD_Attribute.definition: The spacecraft_clock_start_count attribute provides the value of the spacecraft clock at the beginning of a time period of interest.

DD_Attribute.name: spacecraft_clock_stop_count
DD_Attribute.definition: The spacecraft_clock_stop_count attribute provides the value of the spacecraft clock at the end of a time period of interest.

DD_Attribute.name: start_orbit_number
DD_Attribute.definition: Provides the the lowest revolution orbit number that contributed data to a given data product.

DD_Attribute.name: stop_orbit_number
DD_Attribute.definition: Provides the the highest revolution orbit number that contributed data to a given data product.

DD_Attribute.name: total_bursts
DD_Attribute.definition: Total number of bursts on the EDR this orbit.

DD_Attribute.name: x
DD_Attribute.definition: X-coordinate of a unit vector

DD_Attribute.name: y
DD_Attribute.definition: Y-coordinate of a unit vector

DD_Attribute.name: z
DD_Attribute.definition: Z-coordinate of a unit vector

DD_Class.name: X_Axis
DD_Class.definition: X-axis of a coordinate system, as a unit vector

DD_Class.name: Y_Axis
DD_Class.definition: Y-axis of a coordinate system, as a unit vector

DD_Class.name: Z_Axis
DD_Class.definition: Z-axis of a coordinate system, as a unit vector

DD_Class.name: Orbit_Metadata
DD_Class.definition: Parameters related to the timing of this observation

DD_Class.name: BIDR_Keplerians
DD_Class.definition: Keplerians of the spacecraft orbit at the time of this observation

DD_Class.name: BIDR_Oblique_Sinusoidal_Frame_Axes
DD_Class.definition: A specification of the axes of the 3D version of the oblique sinusoidal coordinate system; relative to VBF85 coordinate system

DD_Class.name: BIDR_Parameters
DD_Class.definition: The BIDR_Parameters class is the container for BIDR-specific metadata elements.

DD_Class.name: Magellan_Parameters
DD_Class.definition: The Magellan_Parameters class is the container for mission-specific metadata elements.
